resources.string: Check if your email has been in a data breach
def: To be Pwned ("owned") is to have been the victim of a data breach
Illustration of a person holding a padlock, with representation of user data in web windows in the background. Image from https://undraw.co/illustrations.
Data obtained via a malware. One of your device might have been compromised
Illustration of a person next to a giant smartphone loading data. Image from https://undraw.co/illustrations.
Image showing a men next to a secure browser window. Image from https://undraw.co/illustrations.
Illustration representing a human looking at a password. Image from https://undraw.co/illustrations.

Change your password on the implicated domain.\nIf this couple\'s email and password are used on other domains, change them.\nTo simplify things, you can use a password manager to get unique passwords for each domain.
Illustration representing two-factor authentication with a laptop connected to the web and a server. Image from https://undraw.co/illustrations.

When possible, activate two-factor authentication.\nIf a hacker gets your email and password, the hacker will not be able to access your account.\nAlso, you will be notified anytime someone tries to log in to your account.
